list.name: Changes
list.comment:
Refactor: Simplify Dockerfile for Render deployment
This commit updates the Dockerfile to align with Render's build and deployment process.
Key changes: - Switched from a multi-stage build to a single-stage build using `openjdk:17-jre-slim`. Render handles the JAR building process separately. - Removed manual JAR copying from a build stage; now directly copies `build/libs/fat.jar`. - Removed non-root user creation (`appuser`, `appgroup`) as Render handles this. - Updated port exposure to use `$PORT` environment variable as expected by Render, instead of a hardcoded `8080`. - Changed `ENTRYPOINT` to `CMD` for running the application.

task.summary: Default task
Initial commit
Initial commit
chore: add .env to gitignore
docs: update README with installation and usage instructions & update test case
chore: update project version to actual

Initialize project with Ktor setup and MongoDB integration
This commit includes the basic structure for a Kotlin-based Ktor server. It sets up dependency injection with Koin, MongoDB integration, a routing framework, and basic utility endpoints. Additional configuration includes Gradle scripts, Dokka documentation tasks, and .editorconfig for consistent code styling.

Add support for Java 17, update README, and improve server logs
Updated the project to require Java 17 and revised the README with improved documentation and setup instructions. Enhanced the server initialization with detailed logging and added support for creating a runnable fat JAR for easier deployments.
Update README, enhance logging, and streamline setup

Refactor route registration in UtilRoutes
Simplify route registration logic by removing redundant helper functions and using a more concise approach. Merged route definitions directly into the `Routing.apply` block to improve readability and maintainability.
Refactor route registration in UtilRoutes
Refactor Android vacancy scraper with new models and logger

Add Dou.ua scraper and integrate into vacancy scraper
This commit introduces a new scraper for Dou.ua and integrates it into the existing Android vacancy scraper.
- Added `DouScraper.kt` to handle scraping job listings from Dou.ua. - Updated `Main.kt` to include DouScraper for several companies (Promova, BetterMe, AMO, Boosta). - Temporarily commented out DjinniScraper for focused testing. - Includes logging for scraping stages and individual job parsing.

Add Dou.ua scraper and integrate into vacancy scraper
This commit introduces a new scraper for Dou.ua and integrates it into the existing Android vacancy scraper.
- Added `DouScraper.kt` to handle scraping job listings from Dou.ua. - Updated `Main.kt` to include DouScraper for several companies (Promova, BetterMe, AMO, Boosta). - Temporarily commented out DjinniScraper for focused testing. - Includes logging for scraping stages and individual job parsing.

Add Dou.ua scraper and integrate into vacancy scraper
This commit introduces a new scraper for Dou.ua and integrates it into the existing Android vacancy scraper.
- Added `DouScraper.kt` to handle scraping job listings from Dou.ua. - Updated `Main.kt` to include DouScraper for several companies (Promova, BetterMe, AMO, Boosta). - Temporarily commented out DjinniScraper for focused testing. - Includes logging for scraping stages and individual job parsing.

Refactor: Apply consistent formatting and import order
This commit standardizes code formatting and import statement order across multiple files. Changes include:
- Consistent trailing commas in constructor parameters and argument lists. - Standardized import order (e.g., `ScrapeOutput` before `ScrapeTarget`). - Removal of redundant newlines and spacing.
These changes primarily affect files within the `features.vacanciesandroid` package and `app.routing` / `app.di`. No functional changes are introduced.

Refactor: Centralize vacancy filtering in ScrapeOutput
This commit introduces a static factory method `ScrapeOutput.withFiltering` to centralize the logic for filtering vacancies based on `target.needsFiltering`.
All scrapers (`AmoScraper`, `BreezyScraper`, `DjinniScraper`, `DouScraper`, `LeverScraper`, `NovaDigitalScraper`, `SampleScraper`) have been updated to use this new method, removing redundant filtering logic from each scraper.
Additionally, trailing whitespace has been removed from several files for consistency.

feat: Add Dockerfile and .dockerignore
This commit introduces a Dockerfile for building and running the application in a container.
- The Dockerfile uses a multi-stage build: - Stage 1: `gradle:8.2-jdk21` for building the fat JAR. - Stage 2: `eclipse-temurin:21-jre-alpine` for running the application. - Creates a non-root user `appuser` for running the application. - Exposes port 8080. - Sets the entrypoint to run the `app.jar`.
A `.dockerignore` file is also added to exclude unnecessary files and directories from the Docker build context.

Refactor: Simplify Dockerfile for Render deployment
This commit updates the Dockerfile to align with Render's build and deployment process.
Key changes: - Switched from a multi-stage build to a single-stage build using `openjdk:17-jre-slim`. Render handles the JAR building process separately. - Removed manual JAR copying from a build stage; now directly copies `build/libs/fat.jar`. - Removed non-root user creation (`appuser`, `appgroup`) as Render handles this. - Updated port exposure to use `$PORT` environment variable as expected by Render, instead of a hardcoded `8080`. - Changed `ENTRYPOINT` to `CMD` for running the application.

Refactor: Simplify Dockerfile for Render deployment
This commit updates the Dockerfile to align with Render's build and deployment process.
Key changes: - Switched from a multi-stage build to a single-stage build using `openjdk:17-jre-slim`. Render handles the JAR building process separately. - Removed manual JAR copying from a build stage; now directly copies `build/libs/fat.jar`. - Removed non-root user creation (`appuser`, `appgroup`) as Render handles this. - Updated port exposure to use `$PORT` environment variable as expected by Render, instead of a hardcoded `8080`. - Changed `ENTRYPOINT` to `CMD` for running the application.

MESSAGE.value: docs: update README with installation and usage instructions & update test case
chore: update project version to actual

Add initial project setup for Ktor-based CRUD application
This commit introduces the foundational structure for a Ktor-based server application. Key additions include Gradle build configuration, Koin dependency injection, MongoDB integration, and routing setup with utility endpoints. Also added essential project files like `.editorconfig`, `.gitignore`, and `README.md`.

Initialize Ktor CRUD project with essential setup
Added project configuration for a Ktor-based CRUD application, including Gradle build scripts, dependency management, and MongoDB integration. Implemented basic server setup, DI using Koin, utility routes, and initial tests.

Initialize project with Ktor setup and MongoDB integration
This commit includes the basic structure for a Kotlin-based Ktor server. It sets up dependency injection with Koin, MongoDB integration, a routing framework, and basic utility endpoints. Additional configuration includes Gradle scripts, Dokka documentation tasks, and .editorconfig for consistent code styling.

Add support for Java 17, update README, and improve server logs
Updated the project to require Java 17 and revised the README with improved documentation and setup instructions. Enhanced the server initialization with detailed logging and added support for creating a runnable fat JAR for easier deployments.
Update README, enhance logging, and streamline setup

Refactor route registration in UtilRoutes
Simplify route registration logic by removing redundant helper functions and using a more concise approach. Merged route definitions directly into the `Routing.apply` block to improve readability and maintainability.
Refactor Android vacancy scraper with new models and logger

Add Dou.ua scraper and integrate into vacancy scraper
This commit introduces a new scraper for Dou.ua and integrates it into the existing Android vacancy scraper.
- Added `DouScraper.kt` to handle scraping job listings from Dou.ua. - Updated `Main.kt` to include DouScraper for several companies (Promova, BetterMe, AMO, Boosta). - Temporarily commented out DjinniScraper for focused testing. - Includes logging for scraping stages and individual job parsing.

Refactor: Apply consistent formatting and import order
This commit standardizes code formatting and import statement order across multiple files. Changes include:
- Consistent trailing commas in constructor parameters and argument lists. - Standardized import order (e.g., `ScrapeOutput` before `ScrapeTarget`). - Removal of redundant newlines and spacing.
These changes primarily affect files within the `features.vacanciesandroid` package and `app.routing` / `app.di`. No functional changes are introduced.

Refactor: Centralize vacancy filtering in ScrapeOutput
This commit introduces a static factory method `ScrapeOutput.withFiltering` to centralize the logic for filtering vacancies based on `target.needsFiltering`.
All scrapers (`AmoScraper`, `BreezyScraper`, `DjinniScraper`, `DouScraper`, `LeverScraper`, `NovaDigitalScraper`, `SampleScraper`) have been updated to use this new method, removing redundant filtering logic from each scraper.
Additionally, trailing whitespace has been removed from several files for consistency.

feat: Add Dockerfile and .dockerignore
This commit introduces a Dockerfile for building and running the application in a container.
- The Dockerfile uses a multi-stage build: - Stage 1: `gradle:8.2-jdk21` for building the fat JAR. - Stage 2: `eclipse-temurin:21-jre-alpine` for running the application. - Creates a non-root user `appuser` for running the application. - Exposes port 8080. - Sets the entrypoint to run the `app.jar`.
A `.dockerignore` file is also added to exclude unnecessary files and directories from the Docker build context.

Refactor: Simplify Dockerfile for Render deployment
This commit updates the Dockerfile to align with Render's build and deployment process.
Key changes: - Switched from a multi-stage build to a single-stage build using `openjdk:17-jre-slim`. Render handles the JAR building process separately. - Removed manual JAR copying from a build stage; now directly copies `build/libs/fat.jar`. - Removed non-root user creation (`appuser`, `appgroup`) as Render handles this. - Updated port exposure to use `$PORT` environment variable as expected by Render, instead of a hardcoded `8080`. - Changed `ENTRYPOINT` to `CMD` for running the application.

option.name: LAST_COMMIT_MESSAGE
option.value:
Refactor: Simplify Dockerfile for Render deployment
This commit updates the Dockerfile to align with Render's build and deployment process.
Key changes: - Switched from a multi-stage build to a single-stage build using `openjdk:17-jre-slim`. Render handles the JAR building process separately. - Removed manual JAR copying from a build stage; now directly copies `build/libs/fat.jar`. - Removed non-root user creation (`appuser`, `appgroup`) as Render handles this. - Updated port exposure to use `$PORT` environment variable as expected by Render, instead of a hardcoded `8080`. - Changed `ENTRYPOINT` to `CMD` for running the application.
